title: Jiho Kim
text:
Hi there! I am a Software Engineer at SIL Language Technology.
I recently graduated with a B.C.S. in Computer Science from Calvin University, where I worked with Ken Arnold on intelligent and interactive writing tools.
My research interest is in human-computer interaction. I design, build, and study AI systems that think with people rather than for them, augmenting human intelligence and creativity.
You can reach me at myfirstname@jihokim.dev

Updates


May 4, 2025: I presented the posters of my two workshop papers at the In2Writing workshop at NAACL ’25 in Albuquerque, NM.
November 2, 2024: I was invited to give a talk about my undergraduate research at WMRUGS ’24 in Grand Rapids, MI.
June 20, 2024: I started working as a summer research intern with Juho Kim at KIXLAB.
March 18, 2024: I presented our workshop paper from my summer research at the HAI-GEN workshop at ACM IUI ’24 in Greenville, SC.
February 9, 2024: I was awarded a $1,290 travel grant from the NSF to attend ACM IUI ’24 as a student volunteer.
November 4, 2023: I presented our poster from my summer research at WMRUGS ’23 at the Van Andel Institute in Grand Rapids, MI.
June 1, 2023: I started working as an undergraduate research assistant with Ken Arnold at Calvin University.

title: Research Advice
text:
Choosing topics: timing is crucial; avoid topics that could have been done 6 months earlier.
Project management: finish each project within 6 months, and always run at least 2 projects in parallel.
Aim for goal-driven research rather than purely idea-driven.
When writing papers, start by making a presentation; ensure it convinces three types of reviewers (outsiders, experts, related-field scholars).
Embrace continuous growth through feedback and self-reflection: absorb others’ skills, update personal strengths and weaknesses.
Collaboration: leverage mentors and external collaborators effectively.
